alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Coos County through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Canaan, or near Colebrook, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colebrook, Dixville, Columbia, Clarksville and Stewartstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
